Review contracts for new pricing schedules while researching and implementing new accounts into the accounting systems.

Track daily activity of the firm's new contracts and provide recommendations on financial related issues.
Maintain the accuracy and completeness of all deferred revenues and enforce timely revenue recognition.
Lead and develop methods and implement revenue test models for complex billing structures.
Perform trends analysis on revenues using quantitative methodology and forecast future contingencies.
Maintain the new revenue backlog inventories and periodically testing for appropriateness against new pricing conditions as well as accounting policy determinations.
Identify risky accounts in default and communicate to account managers for corrective actions.
Prepare various ad hoc reports upon request by senior management requiring knowledge of general ledger and supporting sub-ledger details.
Lead, support, and assist the external financial audit process.
Prepare and maintain various incentive payment schedules for the prescriber program.
Lead and support the billing automation effort while streamlining the monthly billing process for more prompt, accurate and timely billing of our customers.
Improve cash flows by meeting targeted projections.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Accounting Manager

Location: Albany, New York Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Management

Description:
Summary of Role:  Responsible for organizing, managing, and leading the daily operations of the Credit Union’s accounting functions, policies and practices. Ensure that accounting and financial procedures are aligned with generally accepted accounting principles. Work with various internal and external parties to ensure adequacy of internal controls and accurate and timely reporting of financial transactions for internal and external use.
Essential Job Functions/Responsibilities:  Review and approve account reconciliations and ensure timely completion to meet corporate deadlines. Review and approve general ledger entries. Oversee the preparation and transmission of regulatory reports, including FRB 2900. Ensures accuracy and timely reporting. Ensure accuracy and efficiency of the accounting department's daily operations. Assist with monthly closing procedures including journal entries, accruals, prepaids, reporting and account reconciliations.Review and analyze month-end financial reports and figures to ensure proper allocation of expenses. Monitor department policies and procedures and recommend improvements. Implement efficiencies within the accounting department to continue to position the department to efficiently support the growth of the Credit Union. Work closely with the Assistant Controller in establishing and implementing major goals and objectives. Responsible for addressing inquiries and resolving problems within the accounting area and other areas if necessary. Serve as primary point of contact for FedLine users and perform administrative maintenance duties as needed. Carry out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws including interviewing, hiring, and training, and participating in the cross training of other accounting personnel in relation to the specific job duties and functions that have been assigned. Perform or assist with other related functions and special projects as needed. 
Minimum Job Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or related field. Three (3) to five (5) years of professional accounting experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Financial institution experience preferred but not required.Experience leading a team, business unit or department.Excellent written and oral communication skillsStrong working knowledge of GAAP.Ability to interpret and apply accounting principles to everyday situations.Ability to perform multiple tasks and priorities at once. Ability to use Word, Excel, PowerPoint and accounting software at a high level of competence.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
